title: Strengthening Medical Practical Skills: Wireless Sensor Network Stability Optimization Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Core networking concepts, data communication principles, and introductory programming experience
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Students can explain the relationship between energy efficiency principles and network stability in cluster-based routing for WSNs.
Students can apply a hybrid SOM and K-means algorithm in a simulation environment to derive optimal cluster sizes.
Students can analyze energy consumption distribution and packet reception rate (PRR) metrics to build a network lifespan prediction model.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
